author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
A local court on Wednesday rejected the anticipatory bail plea of the absconding RJD MLA from Nawada, Rajballabh Yadav, who is accused in a rape case.

Rejecting the plea, Additional District Judge Rashmi Verma in Bihar Sharief of Nalanda district fixed February 19 as the next day of hearing. Earlier, on Tuesday, the court had issued an arrest warrant against the absconding MLA.

Yadav’s advocate argued that his client was implicated in a conspiracy and the victim in her statement under CrPc 164 has not even named him. The MLA is likely to surrender on Thursday.

Earlier, a local RJD leader of Nawada had told local journalists that the Mr. Yadav was not absconding and would surrender on February 18.

After a rape case was lodged against him with Nalanda police, the DIG (central range) Shalin had issued arrest warrant against the MLA on February 13.
title: RJD MLA’s bail plea rejected
